intro: Heteranthus tenuis, commonly known as the slender-flowered heteranthus, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and delicate, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, with five petals that are often unequal in size, a feature typical of the genus Heteranthus. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
